title: How to Prevent Guitar Hero World Tour Drum Kick Pedal from Slipping on Carpet

steps.headline: From the Hardware store purchase a package of plastic Carpet Spike cups(They should cost around $4 for a pack of four).
steps.description: Also purchase approximately 12 inches (30.5 cm) of Velcro.

steps.headline: Using a Dremel or other cutting tool cup the lip off of two or three of the Carpet Spike Cups so that they have a flat surface, as opposed to a cupped surface.
steps.description: (Always wear safety glasses when using a Dremel: Hot plastic in the eye is bad.)

steps.headline: Disconnect the kick pedal from your drum set
On the bottom of the kick pedal slowly peel off the rubber pads from the toe and heel areas.
steps.description: There may still be a thin layer of pad/glue left, this is fine.

steps.headline: Apply the hard plastic side of the Velcro to the toe and heel areas where the rubber pads were.
Apply the soft felt side of the Velcro to the Spike cup(s).
steps.description: Also apply the soft Velcro to the rubber pads.

steps.headline: You can now easily apply and remove the carpet spikes or the rubber pad depending on the surface you are playing on.

(Always wear safety glasses when using a Dremel: Hot plastic in the eye is bad.) Disconnect the kick pedal from your drum set  On the bottom of the kick pedal slowly peel off the rubber pads from the toe and heel areas. There may still be a thin layer of pad/glue left, this is fine. Apply the hard plastic side of the Velcro to the toe and heel areas where the rubber pads were.  Apply the soft felt side of the Velcro to the Spike cup(s). Also apply the soft Velcro to the rubber pads.
